page.title: 12CLUTTON-old mining district
page.content: We interviewed Mr.Owen who is an old age pensioner who lives in Clutton.He started working in the mines when he was 16 and finished at 27. He worked in Pensford, Bromley and Bishop Sutton mines.He did not like working down the mines but he got used to it.It was always pitch black, wet and not very nice. There was some lighting along the main haulage road at the bottom of the shaft.At the coalface, they had to use candles and then carbide lamps.He earned about 1 shilling and 11 pence. There was always foul air down the mines. Mr. Owen then went to work at the station which he liked better because he was in the fresh air. He likes living in Clutton because the people are friendly and he has lived here all his life.
